entries.title: Adani crisis ignites India contagion fears, credit warnings
entries.description: Amid concerns turmoil could hit broader financial system, sources say central bank asked lenders for loan details.

entries.title: ‘Extremely dangerous’ Arctic blast hits northern US and Canada
entries.description: A polar air mass is expected to send temperatures to record lows into the weekend, prompting frostbite warnings.

entries.title: January 6 participants express remorse in court, pride in public
entries.description: Some people who apologised for taking part in attack on US democracy now describe themselves as victims of persecution.

entries.title: Will Spain’s new position on Western Sahara make a difference?
entries.description: Madrid has agreed to support Rabat's plans to grant autonomy to the disputed Western Sahara territory.

entries.title: Ethiopia PM meets Tigray leaders for first time since peace deal
entries.description: Abiy Ahmed holds first face-to-face talks with Tigrayan leaders since a peace deal was agreed in November.

entries.title: EU countries agree price caps on Russian oil products
entries.description: Price caps are the latest in series of Western measures designed to limit Russia's war chest for the assault on Ukraine.

entries.title: Scotland’s gender recognition bill would have harmed women
entries.description: Recognition of trans identities should not come at the cost of women's hard earned sex-based rights and protections.

entries.title: Texas man arrested for allegedly stealing monkeys from Dallas Zoo
entries.description: The zoo has added extra security after the theft of two emperor tamarin monkeys, both of which have been recovered.

entries.title: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi released on bail
entries.description: The award-winning director had gone on hunger strike to protest against his detention, causing a wave of concern.

entries.title: Blinken postpones visit to China because of balloon over US
entries.description: Official: Chinese balloon in US airspace 'unacceptable' but top US diplomat plans to visit China when conditions allow.

entries.title: Meet the Wydad ultras, the Moroccan team’s ‘first player’
entries.description: As Morocco hosts FIFA Club World Cup, members of Winners 2005 group describe their football club as 'source of life'.

entries.title: US adds a surprisingly strong 517,000 jobs despite Fed hikes
entries.description: The labour force participation rate is at its highest since March but still below pre-pandemic levels.

entries.title: Kenyan policemen get sentences for murder of human rights lawyer
entries.description: The murder of human rights lawyer Willie Kimani set off protests in Kenya, where police are often accused of brutality.

entries.title: ‘Beyond imagination’: Pakistan PM warns of IMF bailout conditions
entries.description: An IMF delegation is in Pakistan for last ditch talks to revive financial aid, which has stalled for months.

entries.title: ‘Beyond imagination’: Pakistan PM warns of IMF bailout conditions
entries.description: An IMF delegation is in Pakistan for last ditch talks to revive financial aid, which has stalled for months.

entries.title: Ukraine’s prosecutor launches criminal case against Wagner chief
entries.description: Putin-ally Prigozhin leads a mercenary force of thousands, including ex-convicts, in the Ukraine war.

entries.title: China says balloon over US airspace is civilian airship
entries.description: Foreign ministry says alleged surveillance balloon is used mainly for weather monitoring, deviated from planned course.

entries.title: Russian envoy says 1,890 Russian ‘instructors’ are in CAR
entries.description: The Wagner Group, a Russian mercenary outfit, has become a major player in CAR, displacing former colonial power France.

entries.title: Poland expects global push against Russian, Belarusian athletes
entries.description: Warsaw and the Baltic nations are calling for a ban, but the IOC has suggested Russians and Belarusians could compete.

entries.title: Turkey: No evidence from Western nations after consulate closures
entries.description: Nine countries closed down their consulates in Istanbul or issued travel warnings to citizens after 'security threats'.

entries.title: Tensions simmer among Palestinian prisoners as Israel cracks down
entries.description: Prisoner group says deal has been reached after tough measures were imposed amid escalation of violence.

entries.title: Taliban detains professor who protested ban on women’s education
entries.description: The Taliban confirms the detention of Ismail Mashal, who tore up his degrees to protest against women's education ban.

entries.title: Netflix and Israel: Did ‘Farha’ sabotage a special relationship?
entries.description: Netflix’s decision to feature the likes of the film Farha and the series Mo was a deviation from business as usual.

entries.title: Pregnant woman, four-month-old die in Mediterranean boat tragedy
entries.description: Officials and witnesses say victims suffered from cold and hunger on board a vessel for refugees and migrants.

entries.title: Satellite photos show damage at Iran site hit by drone attack
entries.description: Iran has blamed Israel for the attack in Isfahan last week, threatening to again raise tensions in the region.

entries.title: Brazil’s Lula accuses Bolsonaro of planning January 8 ‘coup’
entries.description: Lula says former leader Bolsonaro 'actively' participated in storming of government buildings.

entries.title: South Sudan violence kills 27 on eve of pope’s visit
entries.description: Pope Francis will arrive in Juba hoping to revive a peace process aimed at ending a decade-long conflict.

entries.title: Are conservatives trying to erase and rewrite US history?
entries.description: From school curriculum changes to book bans, we examine the roots and effects of the anti-Critical Race Theory movement.

entries.title: Can the United States fix its policing problem?
entries.description: In the wake of Tyre Nichols’s killing at the hands of police, UpFront takes a look at policing in the US.

entries.title: Britain is angry and divided, and the Tories don’t get it
entries.description: People need food. They’re instead being fed nationalism by an authoritarian government misreading the public mood.

entries.title: After 102 children, Ugandan villager says enough is enough
entries.description: Musa Hasahya Kasera says his vast family includes 12 wives, 102 children and as many as 578 grandchildren.

entries.title: Peru Congress rejects new bid to advance elections amid protests
entries.description: The motion called to bring forward elections and to hold a referendum on forming a constitutional convention.

entries.title: Fight over Israel’s judiciary as Palestinians look on
entries.description: Protests continue against PM Netanyahu's moves to weaken the Supreme Court, as violence escalates in occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 345
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 345th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: China to reopen borders with Hong Kong, Macau after COVID closure
entries.description: Borders have been closed for nearly three years, separating families and disrupting tourism and other businesses.

entries.title: Biden stands by Jerusalem status quo in meeting with Jordan king
entries.description: The US president praised Jordan for its 'crucial role' as the custodian of Muslim holy places in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Democracy ‘on trial’ as Hong Kong 47 prepare to face court
entries.description: Picked up in a dawn raid two years ago, the activists and politicians are charged over an unofficial primary.

entries.title: Apple, Google profits squeezed on China, sluggish economies
entries.description: Apple reports first drop in quarterly revenue since 2019 as China's zero-COVID policy disrupted iPhone output.

entries.title: Nearly 1,000 migrant families still separated by Trump-era policy
entries.description: More than 3,800 children were removed from families between 2017 and 2021 as part of a crackdown on border crossings.

entries.title: Why Myanmar’s opposition is calling for a ban on jet fuel
entries.description: Myanmar military takes fight against coup opponents to the skies as it loses ground on the battlefield.
